intro: Pedicularis hemsleyana, commonly known as the Hemsley's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold climates. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
